meanings.sent1: Her cheerful personality is the antipode of his gloomy demeanor.
meanings.sent2: The black cat was the antipode of the white dog.
meanings.sent3: In a strange twist of fate, the villain turned out to be the antipode of the hero.
meanings.sent4: Their political views were like antipodes, never meeting in the middle.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful garden was the antipode of the bustling city.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is the exact opposite of another
meanings.sent1: She was his antipode, always disagreeing on everything.
meanings.sent2: The cold winter was the antipode of the hot summer.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse seemed like the antipode of the giant elephant.
meanings.sent4: Their personalities clashed like antipodes, never finding common ground.
meanings.sent5: The quiet introvert was the antipode of the outgoing extrovert.

meanings.definition: The point on the opposite side of the Earth from a given point
meanings.sent1: If you dig straight down, you will reach the antipode of your location.
meanings.sent2: Australia is often considered the antipode of the United States.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his antipode must be living in a parallel universe.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship felt like they were each other's antipodes, never quite connecting.
meanings.sent5: The idea of standing on the antipode of the world fascinated him.
